name: Elementary-OS
description: elementary OS is a Linux distribution based on Ubuntu, known for its strong emphasis on design, simplicity, and user experience. It was first released in 2011 and is developed by Elementary, Inc., with a focus on being a fast, open, and privacy-respecting alternative to macOS and Windows.

sections.title: Early Years
sections.text: elementary OS began as a set of design and usability improvements for Ubuntu before evolving into a full-fledged distribution. The first version, codenamed 'Jupiter', was released in 2011 and introduced the Pantheon desktop environment.

sections.title: Growth and Development
sections.text: Over the years, elementary OS has developed its own apps, system components, and desktop environment. The team emphasizes consistency and minimalism, creating custom software like Epiphany (web browser), Code (text editor), and Music (audio player).

sections.title: Current Status
sections.text: Today, elementary OS is widely praised for its clean design and beginner-friendly interface. It continues to be based on Ubuntu LTS releases and has a strong focus on curated apps through its pay-what-you-want AppCenter.

sections.title: Design and Philosophy
sections.text: elementary OS follows a strict Human Interface Guidelines (HIG) philosophy, ensuring all apps integrate seamlessly. It aims to offer a distraction-free computing experience, with privacy-respecting defaults, minimalist design, and intuitive navigation.
